title: Sim test cannot be run locally on Mac and Windows

labels.name: meta-bug
labels.description: Issues that identify a bug and require a fix.

body:
### Describe the bug

Currently with how sim test is set up with `ethereumjsdocker`, `gethdocker` and `netherminddocker`, it requires docker to use host network to run. 
eg.  In gethdocker/post-merge.sh: `docker run ... --network host ... $EL_BINARY_DIR ...`

Host network driver is not available on Mac and Windows as per https://docs.docker.com/network/network-tutorial-host/#prerequisites . So we can either 
1) Mention in the contribution [doc](https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/blob/unstable/docs/pages/contribution/testing/simulation-tests.md?plain=1) that `yarn test:sim` is not available in the aforementioned platforms. Which should be fine as contributors rarely need to run sim tests locally but to pass the CI.
2) Deploy a workaround suggested by the official docker [docs](https://docs.docker.com/desktop/networking/#i-want-to-connect-to-a-container-from-the-host) which forwards the necessary ports to the host ie. `-p $ETH_PORT:$ETH_PORT -p $ENGINE_PORT:$ENGINE_PORT`. Note this way we will also need to update the address the EL client listens to. For example `--http.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0` for geth. 

### Expected behavior

To run sim tests `yarn test:sim` locally on Macs and Windows without error

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_
